documents.content: Arizona Horizon Health reported an unusual cluster of idiopathic cardiomyopathy cases linked to genetic markers in individuals of Polynesian descent. Patient ID# PX-88723 was admitted on 06/15/2023 for advanced cardiac monitoring. Treatment included a tailored regimen of sacubitril/valsartan and ongoing genetic counseling. Dr. Elena Varga noted the patient's participation in study NCT04567823 exploring familial cardiomyopathy patterns. Address on file: 2301 W. Catalina Dr., Phoenix, AZ 85029.

Notification: Policy revision #PHX-CARD-2023-09 effective October 1 mandates pre-authorization for advanced genetic testing related to cardiomyopathies. Impacted members include those with ICD-10 codes I42.8-I42.9 and participant IDs beginning with PX. Provider queries should be directed to geneticcounseling@azhh.com or (602) 555-0172. Processing times may increase during transition period.

Community Health Digest (09/10/2023): Phoenix cardiology practices see 37% increase in genetic testing volumes since January. Arizona Horizon Health's research division published interim findings from NCT04567823, showing 58% of participants with RBM20 variants required hospitalization within 12 months. Outreach events scheduled at Papago Cultural Center through Q4.

Claim #89022-331: 11/02/2023 echocardiogram and genetic panel for PX-88723 (DOB 04/19/1985) processed with partial denial. Code Z13.6 requires additional documentation per policy PHX-CARD-2023-09. Patient responsibility: $340. Coordinator notes indicate follow-up with Dr. Varga's office requested regarding variant interpretation.
